intro: Schlegelia ramizii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Schlegelia ramizii has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is a relatively rare species, often found in specific ecological zones within its native range.
